intro: Stilpnopappus trichospiroides, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant produces small, yellowish ray flowers surrounded by a cluster of tubular florets. Its leaves are typically hairy and adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Stilpnopappus trichospiroides is often found in sandy soils and thrives in full sunlight.
